text: Rose Hart (born January 9, 1942) is a retired female track and field athlete from Ghana. She specialised in the hurdling, the sprints and the discus throw events during her career. Hart represented Ghana at the 1964 Olympic Games. She twice claimed a gold medal for her native West African country at the All- Africa Games: 1965 and 1973. ==References== * sports-reference Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:Ghanaian female hurdlers Category:Ghanaian discus throwers Category:Ghanaian female sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of Ghana Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Female discus throwers Category:Commonwealth Games competitors for Ghana Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1966 British Empire and Commonwealth Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1974 British Commonwealth Games Category:African Games gold medalists for Ghana Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1965 All-Africa Games
title: Rose Hart
